page.title: 19BIOGRAPHY
page.content: {BETTYHILL AMBULANCE DRIVER }Very often in small villages, people have more than one job. This is essential so that services can be maintained. One man who has several jobs is the local ambulance driver who is also car hirer and shop keeper in addition to running a large croft. We interviewed the driver to find out what having all these jobs is like. He told us he preferred working on his croft and sometimes had very long runs to do with the ambulance between Inverness, Wick, Golspie or Thurso. He enjoys living and working in Bettyhill but would like to see a proper access road to Farr Beach and a youth centre built in Bettyhill to accommodate the teenagers.
